840270818573569.title: Finance Manager, Facebook
840270818573569.responsibilities: Act as a trusted Finance partner for Product, Engineering, and cross functional Tech leaders. Work collaboratively with these groups to drive continuous improvement in initiatives regarding headcount and expense planning, product investment strategy, and capital allocation Drive nuanced return on investment (ROI) and impact frameworks across headcount, expense, and other investments Proactively lead analytics and projects requiring expertise in Facebook’s business model and share your insights with relevant stakeholders Present financial reporting and forecasts to stakeholders across Facebook and Finance Collaborate with horizontal Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) teams and Corporate FP&A to improve and operationalize processes related to core FP&A activities
840270818573569.minimum_qualifications: 10+ years of experience in rigorous FP&A, Strategic Finance, Business Operations, or related organizations demonstrating increasing levels of responsibility Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Finance, Math, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline Experience using analytical and quantitative modeling skills, including buildout of headcount, operating and driver-based financial models (Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, SQL) Demonstrated history of building trusted business partner relationships at increasingly executive levels, influencing decisions, and driving alignment on financial targets Consistently takes initiative and approaches business challenges and opportunities with curiosity, clarity, and intention Experience synthesizing strategic insights and problem solving individually or in a group setting
840270818573569.preferred_qualifications: Advanced degree such as a MS in quantitative field

1504594883912480.title: Area Schedule Lead - Data Center Design, Engineering and Construction
1504594883912480.location: Menlo Park, CA • Fremont, CA • Remote, US • Full Time + 2 more • Full Time - Hide
1504594883912480.responsibilities: Technical lead in Schedule Controls on the specified Mega Campus including baseline schedule reviews, schedule updates & reporting, E2E Schedule updates and internal coordination reviews, IMS schedule updates and execution team coordination reviews, schedule change management/Extension of Time (EOT) approval, delay tracking, schedule metric/quality, schedule delay mitigation, and risk facilitation Responsible for application of commercial entitlement for schedule changes and Extension of Time (EOT) in their region. Provide leadership to site teams, Project Controls Analysts and CW Schedulers for Delay Tracking, Extension of Time (EOT) requests and claims. Coordinate the change evaluation in collaboration with the cost team as part of the Change Management review process. Responsible for making recommendations that are in line with the contract and escalating when site decisions differ from the contractual language Support the development of delay mitigation ideas and work directly with Site Leadership in collaboration with other Area Schedule Leads to make recommendations Responsible for the review and approval of all GC and TP Precon Baseline Schedules. In conjunction with the Meta PreCon Manager and with the support of the CW Site Scheduling team Area Schedule Lead will work with GCs & TPs to develop Baseline schedules and resolve all quality and logic issues prior to submission. They will ensure Baseline schedules meet program expectations and are delivered in the agreed upon timeline for the project Analyze and communicate Area’s Project Controls Health (Schedule, & Risk) in support of the Area Project Controls Manager and DEC Leadership and provide escalation when needed Identify proactive project commercial risk in collaboration with other Area Leads, Delivery team and cross-functional partners and support programmatic schedule delay review and mitigation activities Support CW Site Schedules in Area and provide feedback to CW Account leads on any concerns, quality issues, or additional training needed. Support Area by training all new Site Schedulers on processes and procedures and working with Area Managers to ensure projects are adequately staffed and supported Provide support of Area’s schedule reviews, and ensure Proactive Risk Indicators are being identified and used appropriately to identify risk. Support monthly/quarterly communication to site leadership and Strategic Planning & Analytics on schedule risk and health in support of MCP Direct communication with Area Cost Lead to ensure collaboration and alignment of project health between cost and schedule and overall project risk and direct support and coaching for Project Controls Analysts Strategize and drive programmatic efficiencies and opportunities for future Business Controls within DEC including continued alignment with other Area Schedule Leads Work directly with Retrofit Schedule Lead to ensure alignment of processes and procedures and ensure all schedule reporting and risks are escalated properly to Area Managers and site leadership teams Approximately 50% travel to other Data Center sites within the Area and home office
1504594883912480.minimum_qualifications: 10+ years of Planning, Scheduling, Construction Management, or Related field experience Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or Equivalent Technical Field or related field experience Subject Matter Expert in Primavera P6, Microsoft Project, Smartsheets, Lean Planner, TAKT Planning, and other scheduling related methodologies and software Familiar with Earned Value Management, Resource Loaded Schedules, or collection and analysis of resource data Experience developing/managing an Owner’s planning/scheduling program Familiar with Data Center, Manufacturing, Infrastructure or Construction programs requiring complicated commissioning specifications Demonstrated analytical, communication, problem solving, prioritization, organization and reporting skills
1504594883912480.preferred_qualifications: Experience identifying schedule efficiencies and driving programmatic or organizational alignment in changing execution strategies to optimize schedule performance Experience negotiating schedule changes or complex construction claims Successful development and implementation of scheduling or project controls strategies in a large organization Familiar with complex networking systems and electrical infrastructure Experience managing a team of Contingent Worker Schedulers

Own the KPI roadmap, including the development of definitions, performance drivers and other insights, root cause and corrective action analysis and leadership commentary on our progress. Collaborate cross-functionally to provide thought leadership and prioritize organizational use cases where data and analytics can add value addressing both Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics use cases (Model Development, Artificial Intelligence). Collaborate in decision making regarding business and technical trade-offs in data architecture, data governance, measurement strategies and data security. Give a voice to the data and influence future efforts using the power of the teams’ insights.
